Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which the financial bad management practices have been eliminated or cut significantly.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that every single bad management practice has been eliminated or significantly reduced.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all financial bad management practices inherited by the mayor have been addressed, without providing specific details or examples.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors contributing to the improvement in city finances, not solely attributed to the elimination or reduction of bad management practices.
